thread.title: Topless Gino D'Acampo paints abs on himself as he dresses up as Peter Andre for VERY sexual Lip Sync Battle
thread.title_full: Topless Gino D'Acampo paints abs on himself as he dresses up as Peter Andre for VERY sexual Lip Sync Battle

author: Emmeline Saunders
title: Topless Gino D'Acampo paints abs on himself as he dresses up as Peter Andre for VERY sexual Lip Sync Battle
text:
Topless Gino D'Acampo paints abs on himself as he dresses up as Peter Andre for VERY sexual Lip Sync Battle He then went head-to-head with Peter himself, in one of the greatest pieces of television ever made Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Peter Andre smashes Missy Elliott lip sync in blonde wig Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Gino D'Acampo stripped off and flirted outrageously with Mel C in one of the most disturbing Lip Sync Battles to date. 
The This Morning chef dressed up as 90s-era Peter Andre - complete with abs painted on his stomach - and ripped open his shirt halfway through his rendition of Mysterious Girl. 
In a weird twist, Peter himself was standing by the sidelines when this was all happening, as he was facing off against Gino in the show. Gino D'Acampo performed as Peter Andre - complete with fake abs (Photo: Channel 5) 
After his performance, Gino allowed presenter Mel to admire his faux-abs and boasted of having "a nine-pack". 
When Mel questioned him on the location of his ninth muscle, Gino simply pointed down to his penis. 
Earlier in the episode, he'd sexually propositioned the Spice Girl, telling he he'd "re-f*** her" any time she wanted. 
Meanwhile, Peter performed a tribute to rapper Missy Elliott in the same episode of Lip Sync Battle UK. Lip Sync Battle UK Se 2 Ep 4 Peter Andre vs Gino Di Campo (Photo: Channel 5) 
And the show went ALL out for Peter's costume – complete with a very blonde wig. 
The dad of four wore a custom pair of denim jeans and sleeveless jacket covered in purple holographic patterns. Read More Fans say Peter Andre looks just like daughter Princess in adorable childhood throwback picture 
As he performed Missy’s 2001 hit, Peter cavorted around the stage and finally approached his rival Gino. 
Peter put one foot seductively on Gino’s chair as he threatened to get up close and personal with the chef. 
In the final episode this Friday Peter will also perform Michael Jackson’s Bad. Read More Peter Andre's dig at Katie Price for allowing their kids on social media: 'I'm very strict about things like that' Peter Andre went all out with his costume (Photo: Channel 5) 
Gino also performed to R. Kelly’s I Believe I Can Fly while trussed up in a harness – much to the delight of the show’s hosts Mel B and Professor Green. 
He told them: "My right testicle is under the left one - I don't think I can have any more children." 
But he lost out to Peter, who took home the giant victory belt. 
Last week, Katie Price performed as Dolly Parton on the Channel 5 show. 
The former glamour model’s appearance on Channel 5’s lip-syncing show had been heavily teased prior to Friday night’s show airing, with a clip of her twerking to My Humps doing the rounds earlier this week. 
Katie performed two songs on the night - the Black Eyed Peas’ boobular ode My Humps and Dolly Parton’s employment-is-annoying anthem 9 to 5. 
But it was her outing as Dolly which really showcased her talents. The former glamour model shimmied around the stage in a pink suit and giant blonde beehive wig, threw rubbish out of a wastepaper bin and at one point danced with a woman who inexplicably looked like she'd nicked Gail Platt's hair. Gino also performed R. Kelly's I Believe I Can Fly (Photo: Channel 5) 
While some commenters branded the performance ‘cringey’, others praised Katie for her miming prowess against her opposition on the night, Ben Fogle. 
“You were brilliant such a good sport,” wrote one Twitter user, while several fans couldn’t believe she lost out to rival Ben, saying, “Well done Katie you were robbed!” 
* Lip Sync Battle UK continues on Friday at 10pm on Channel 5. Like us on Facebook
